items.entry: Treasure. An art object created as an act of resistance to tyranny, or a magic item that protects against restraint (such as a {@item Ring of Free Action}).

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A group of people rebelling against a ruler or an authority figure.

cards.name: Tomb
entries: {@i A burial chamber holds a plain stone casket. The Tomb card suggests buried secrets and things long forgotten.}

items.name: Person
items.entry: A person with a secret or a gap in their memory.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A {@creature mummy}, {@creature wight}, or similar Undead that lairs in its own tomb.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A tomb, especially one that is forgotten.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: Valuable or magical funerary treasure.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A situation no one wants to talk about or even acknowledge.

items.name: Person
items.entry: A person trying to atone for a dreadful secret in their past.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: An incorporeal Undead (such as a {@creature wraith} or {@creature specter}) that's not linked to the place of its death, burial place, or body.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A memorial structure that doesn't contain a body.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: An art object depicting a dead individual as they were in life.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A situation stemming from a buried secret that recently came to light.

cards.name: Tower
entries: {@i A tall, ornate tower made of black stone looms over a desolate landscape. The Tower card represents isolation.}

items.name: Person
items.entry: A person who prefers solitude to the company of others.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A reclusive creature.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A remote tower or similar place of isolation.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: An art object depicting an isolated place or a lonely person; alternatively, {@item Daern's Instant Fortress} or a similar magic item.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A situation that requires assistance or information from a reclusive person.

items.name: Person
items.entry: A desperately lonely person who craves close companionship.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A creature cut off from others of its kind that is trying to find them, or a trap that targets a single creature.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A place that discourages interaction with others, such as a library or monastery, where rules of silence are strictly enforced.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: An art object expressing the artist's profound loneliness.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A situation arising from someone's loneliness or boredom.

cards.name: Tree
entries: {@i A tree has broken through a fortress wall and reclaimed part of the keep. This card suggests perseverance in difficult circumstances.}

items.name: Person
items.entry: A strong-willed person determined to persevere despite hostile conditions.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A creature that thrives in a hostile environment.

items.name: Place
items.entry: Somewhere vegetation makes an unexpected appearance: a park in a busy urban center or a tree growing on barren rock.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: A treasure featuring diamonds, pearls, or precious wood, or a magic item that increases endurance (such as an {@item Amulet of Health}).

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A small outpost or lone individual holding back a much larger force.

items.name: Person
items.entry: Someone barely hanging on in hostile conditions.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A creature driven from its preferred environment and struggling to survive in a new region.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A place cleared of natural growth.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: An art object or a magic item made from the wood of a tree struck by lightning.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: An overwhelming threat against a small outpost or lone individual.

cards.name: Undead
entries: {@i A lich beckons souls of the dead. This card can point to anything that refuses to die, from old grudges and unresolved issues to Undead creatures.}

items.name: Person
items.entry: A person nursing a grudge beyond reason.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: An Undead creature sustained by a thirst for revenge or an unfinished task, such as a {@creature ghost} or {@creature revenant}.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A place haunted (literally or emotionally) by a terrible event that happened there.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: A treasure depicting the dead or an Undead, something made from bones, or a magic item made by or for an Undead.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: Someone who refuses to leave the past in the past.

items.name: Person
items.entry: A person too quick to forgive and forget, who never holds anyone accountable for their misdeeds.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: An Undead creature that craves an end to its miserable, interminable existence.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A place whose denizens have forgotten significant events that happened there.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: An art object depicting the destruction of an Undead, or a magic item particularly useful against Undead (such as a {@item Mace of Disruption}).

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A serial criminal who has been pardoned for past misdeeds and now continues their wicked ways.

cards.name: Void
entries: {@i An endless void seems to spiral toward a central hole that devours all. This card spells disaster.}

items.name: Person
items.entry: A person trapped in despair.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A Fiend or an Undead that threatens annihilation of body and soul, or a trap with no easy exit or escape.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A place deep underground, underwater, or in space, where little light and air are available.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: An art object that reflects its creator's despair or sadness, or a {@item Sphere of Annihilation}.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A situation that seems to have no good or even survivable—outcome.

items.name: Person
items.entry: A person who has lost everything and has no place left to go but up.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A {@creature skeleton}, {@creature zombie}, or similar Undead remnant of a living creature; alternatively, a trap that's broken and nonfunctional.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A place of utter carnage, where a terrible battle or massacre took place.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: A treasure promised but not actually present, such as an empty treasure chest or a looted vault.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: The aftermath of a destructive event, where the few survivors must figure out how to go on living.

cards.name: Warrior
entries: {@i A barbarian holds a greataxe, The Warrior card embodies physical strength and fighting acumen.}

items.name: Person
items.entry: A person (perhaps a barbarian, fighter, or monk) who has trained in combat or served in the military.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A creature with abilities like those of a barbarian, fighter, or monk.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A training yard or fort where warriors learn combat skills.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: A valuable or magical weapon or suit of armor.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A situation that requires and rewards the skilled application of physical force.

items.name: Person
items.entry: A bully who uses physical strength to intimidate others.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A creature that relies on brute strength, or a trap that can be escaped through the application of brute strength.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A harsh environment where only the physically powerful survive.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: An unsubtle work of art.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A situation involving bullying or extortion.

cards.name: Well
entries: {@i A stone well stands in a peaceful meadow, surrounded by wildflowers. The Well card speaks of drawing resources from familiar places.}

items.name: Person
items.entry: A familiar person who is a reliable source of information and aid.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A familiar kind of creature, whose abilities are well understood.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A well, a familiar shop, or a place where fresh water can be found.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: A reliable treasure (such as gold coins), or a magic item that produces food or water (such as a {@item Decanter of Endless Water} or an {@item Alchemy Jug}).

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A familiar situation with a predictable outcome.

items.name: Person
items.entry: A familiar person who refuses to provide expected aid.

items.name: Creature or Trap
items.entry: A familiar kind of creature whose behavior or abilities are surprising.

items.name: Place
items.entry: A well that has gone dry, or a familiar place that no longer offers the comforts it used to.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: A treasure with unexpected properties—a hidden compartment or magical quirk that's not immediately evident.

items.name: Situation
items.entry: A familiar situation that ends up defying expectations.

entries: The following pages describe the meanings of the sixty-six cards in The {@deck Deck of Many More Things|DMTCRG|Deck of Many Things} card set. For each card, there's an illustration and a description of the symbols depicted, a summary of the card's overall meaning, and explanations of what the card might signify in both upright and reversed (upside-down) positions. Each position includes five possible signifiers to choose from based on the situation:

items: A {@b person}, with suggestions regarding personality traits or the situation the person is in. A person can be any kind of Humanoid, but might also be a Giant, a Dragon, or any other creature with a personality and the ability to interact with characters. This signifier might also describe something about the person for whom a card reading is being done.
A {@b creature or trap} characters might encounter.
A {@b place}, which can suggest a specific location or a kind of location.
A {@b treasure}, either something of monetary value or a magic item.
A {@b situation}—an interaction or circumstance that characters might be asked to help address.

entries: When using the cards for divinatory readings, you can use cards' overall meaning or draw on any signifiers that make sense for your game. The adventure spreads typically draw on all five kinds of signifiers to build the skeleton of an adventure.
